ESP.ORIGINAL: O'Doyle
ESP.TRADUIT: 奥多伊尔

ESP.ORIGINAL:
O'Doyle and the rest of Primm are a bunch of saps.
Took his girl and held her ransom, had some fun. Dumb bastard paid up like we asked, then acted surprised when we delivered her body. What the fuck did he expect? Bitch was falling apart after a few days, had to put her down. At least the boys had some fun with her before it was all said and done.
Gonna have to do this again. Beagle and the rest of the town won't put up a fight, and NCR is tied down. Easy money!
ESP.TRADUIT:
奥多伊尔和普瑞姆的其他人都是一群蠢货。
绑架了他的女朋友，拿了赎金，找了点乐子。那个蠢货照我们说的付了钱，然后我们把她的尸体交给他时，他表现得很惊讶。他他妈还指望什么？那婊子没过几天就崩溃了，不得不让她安乐死。至少在事情还没结束之前，孩子们还跟她玩了一会儿。
我得再来一次。比格尔和镇上其他的人不会反抗，NCR也被束缚住了。轻松赚钱！

ESP.ORIGINAL: Diary of Benjamin Hines, Vol. 1
ESP.TRADUIT: 《本杰明·海恩斯日记》，第一卷

ESP.ORIGINAL:
April 5, 2270: I can barely sleep tonight, so I just started writing. I've begun a new chapter in my life, and I have an urge to document my upcoming adventure. It's a great honor to be given the assignment of seeking out an uncontacted tribe and recording its language and culture. After living in the classroom for so long, digesting and regurgitating information, I'm excited at the prospect of finally putting it to use! These anthropological surveys are competitive posts within the Followers. I just hope I don't disappoint Dr. Graham. He's been such a fine mentor to me.
Little is known about the people I'm seeking, other than occasional sightings and hearsay from prospectors. Based on cursory descriptions, they seem to be nomadic hunter-gatherers who follow Bighorners. Most of the old maps point to a mountain range called the "New York Mountains". Who was York, I wonder?
I've double-checked my pack, and all the rations are in place. Dr. Graham insisted I carry a rifle, even though I hate the idea of using it. The last thing I want to do is hurt something. This world has more than enough wounds. That's what dad could never understand. He thought joining the Followers was foolish, calling it a waste of time. He can keep the ranch. God knows he has enough bastards who can inherit his fortune. I never liked Brahmin anyway. I wonder what he would say if he could see me - a bonafide, vegetarian, pacifist Follower of the Apocalypse. It would probably do him in.
At least mom would be proud. Sun will be up soon. I need to at least try to rest before I head off.
April 9, 2275: Thus far my expedition has been relatively uneventful, save a close call with some geckos near Nipton. After seeing that cesspit, I'm all the more eager to escape from "civilization". I'm staying the night in Searchlight, which is quaint, but hospitable. The weather has already begun turning much warmer in the past few days. I couldn't imagine making this trip in the summer.
I was sore after the first few days of walking, but I believe my limbs are growing accustomed to the demands of this lengthy peregrination. Now I almost look forward to my daily exertion, though I wish the pack was lighter. It's quite a change from the Mormon Fort.
It's interesting when I tell locals what I'm doing - their reactions are risible, to say the least. Most of them gasp in disbelief, then scoff at my mission as folly. Many tell me that I'll be scalped or otherwise brutalized by "savages". I try to downplay it, but I know it's a risk. These people could be more bellicose than expected. However, if they've been truly isolated since the war, I can't imagine them being too hostile. I'll have to be very careful to learn and respect their cultural norms. I can't wait to meet them.
April 15, 2275. After almost a week, I've finally reached the canyon. It's simply pristine - arid and pure, almost as I imagined it would be. It's smaller than I thought it would be, but that's to be expected. Anytime I hear the word "canyon", I imagine gaping chasms that span for miles. This isn't a pit, though - it's a preserve. Aside from a derelict train station and rails, there is no indication of development.
No sign of the locals yet, but I'm going to set up an observation post on the western rim. I noticed some radscorpions on the southern hills, so I'll keep my distance. It gets surprisingly chilly at night, so I'll finally get to use those blankets I packed. The local flora seems vibrant, and I've managed to collect a few yucca bits to supplement my rations. They are delicious.
I'm laying on my stomach now, writing as I peer across this expanse, hoping to see a human figure. I'm hoping to document their patterns and behavior before establishing contact. Nothing but geckos right now, but I'll wait.
April 17, 2275. I was on the verge of abandoning this spot when I finally saw one of them. It was a young man, probably a scout of some sort. He was a physical specimen, lean as a snake, and he moved with such ease and grace, like a dancer. He was adorned with an amalgam of hides, rags, and various objects. He had a number of tattoos or body paintings, though it was difficult to distinguish through the binoculars.
He was tracking geckos, and managed to remain unseen by his quarry until his spear skewered one of the creatures. It was a magnificent scene, so much that I almost forgot my aversion to bloodshed. However, I found myself getting queasy when he field-dressed the poor beast.
Soon thereafter, he swiftly collected the hide and meat, then departed across the ridge with the same celerity and stealth with which he entered. What a remarkable day!
April 18, 2275. After agonizing on whether or not to follow the young scout's trail, I was stunned this morning when a group of fifty tribals manifested in the canyon below. They are almost certainly nomads, as they are constantly monitoring the nearby Bighorner herd.
Far from simple savages, these people exhibit profound empathy and mutual support, as I noticed several elderly among their number, all of whom were supported by fellow tribesmen. When I noticed their encampment at dawn, they had already set out on their daily tasks, with many of the women and children gathering, while the adult men hunted in groups. There is no bickering or infighting that I can see. That is already a welcome change from the Mojave.
Though I've only observed them for one day, I suspect they practice polygamy. I'm hoping to gain a better understanding of their society once I make contact tomorrow.
April 19, 2275. This was a day of many firsts. I'm still shaking from excitement! I approached the camp this morning, moving in a steady, deliberate fashion as coached by Dr. Graham. As would be fitting, it was a group of children who first spotted me. Far from fearing me, I was an object of immediate fascination, given my dress and manner.
Within a few minutes, I found myself surrounded by the bulk of the tribe, men and women alike, all gawking and gingerly touching my coat. They kept calling me "Extranjero". Though it's too early to be certain, I believe they speak a pidgin form of English with many Spanish loanwords. I could make out a few cognate phrases: "Who?", "Where?", "Matre", "Patre", but little else. I tried muttering, "Slowly" and "Despacio", to no avail.
Soon I was taken to meet a group of old men, likely some type of senior council. Though communication was limited, I managed to convey that my intentions were peaceful, and that I was living on a rock above their camp. They seemed wary of my improvised sign language, but eagerly drew pictograms in the dirt. I reciprocated by showing that I came from north of the canyon, from a great city, filled with many lights. They were impressed.
These people are the most hospitable hosts I've ever met. Immediately after my meeting with the elders, I was ushered to a large tent and offered all manner of food, most of it meat. I willed myself to smile as I choked down roasted bighorner. The initial impressions are crucial, so my dietary preferences may have to suffer for a time. I can infer that it would be offensive if I refused any food outright.
I was also offered clothes, and presumably, a place to stay. During the entirety of my education, I never anticipated meeting such a civil, amicable body of human beings. They are the best of our species.
April 20, 2275. Awkwardly adorned in hides, I am beginning to mimic the habits and manners of the tribespeople here. I have not yet ascertained their collective name, though I suspect it is connected to some canid deity. I am taking copious notes on their language, and I hope to produce a primitive dictionary before I conclude my study.
I can say one thing with certainty - this is a polygamous society. It seems each man takes multiple wives, and the number of wives is the only visible social distinction in this otherwise egalitarian culture.
Tomorrow will be eventful, I suspect - it seems some of the men want to take me hunting.
ESP.TRADUIT:
2270年4月5日:
我今晚睡不着，所以就开始写了。我的人生开始了新的篇章，我很想记录下即将到来的冒险。
我很荣幸能被指派去寻找一个与世隔绝的部落并记录下它的语言和文化。在教室里生活了这么长时间，消化和反馈了信息，我很兴奋，因为我期待着最终将它付诸使用!这些人类学调查是竞争职位的追随者。我只希望我不会让格雷厄姆医生失望。他是我的良师益友。
除了偶尔的目击和探矿者的道听途说外，我对我要找的人知之甚少。根据粗略的描述，他们似乎是跟随大角族人的游牧狩猎采集者。大部分的旧地图都指向一座被称为“新约克山”的山脉。我想知道约克是谁?
我仔细检查了我的背包，所有的口粮都准备好了。格雷厄姆医生坚持让我带着步枪，尽管我讨厌用它。我最不想做的就是伤害什么东西。这个世界有太多的伤痛。这是爸爸永远无法理解的。他认为加入天启追随者是愚蠢的，说这是浪费时间。他可以留着农场。他有足够多的私生子可以继承他的财产。反正我从来都不喜欢婆罗门。我想知道如果他看到我......一个真正的、素食主义者、世界末日的和平主义者，他会说些什么。这可能会让他崩溃。
至少妈妈会感到骄傲。太阳马上就要升起来了。我至少得在出发前休息一下。
2275年4月9日:
到目前为止，我的探险还算平安无事，除了在尼普顿附近从几只蜥蜴手下死里逃生。看到那个污水坑后，我更加渴望逃离“文明”。我今晚住在探照灯营地，这里有点古怪，但很好客。过去几天天气已经开始变暖了。我无法想象在夏天进行这次旅行。
刚开始几天的步行让我感到疼痛，但我相信我的四肢已经适应了这种漫长的旅行。现在我几乎期待着每天的锻炼，尽管我希望背包能轻一些。这些跟摩门教的堡垒比起来真是大不一样。
当我告诉当地人我在做什么时，他们的反应至少可以说是可笑的。他们中的大多数人感到难以置信，然后嘲笑我的使命是愚蠢的。许多人告诉我，我会被剥头皮或被“野蛮人”残忍对待。我想轻描淡写，但我知道有风险。这些人可能比预期的更好斗。然而，如果他们在战争后真的被孤立了，我无法想象他们会有太多敌意。我必须非常小心地学习和尊重他们的文化规范。我等不及要见他们了。
2275年4月15日。
差不多一周后，我终于到达了峡谷。它确实是原始的--干旱而纯净，几乎和我想象的一样。不过这里比我想象中的要小，不过也不算太过意外。每当我听到“峡谷”这个词，我就会想象绵延数英里的裂口。但这不是坑，这是保护区。除了一个废弃的火车站和铁路，没有任何发展的迹象。
还没有发现当地人的踪迹，但我要在西边建立一个观察点。我在山的南边发现了一些辐射蝎，所以我要保持安全距离。晚上出奇的冷，我终于可以用我打包的毯子了。当地的植物似乎生机勃勃，我也设法收集了一些丝兰来补充我的口粮。他们是美味的。
我现在趴在地上，一边写着日记，一边望着这片广阔的土地，希望能看到一个人的身影。我希望在联系他们之前记录下他们的模式和行为。现在只有蜥蜴，但我会等的。
2275年4月17日。
我正打算放弃这个地方时，终于看到了他们中的一员。那是个年轻人，可能是个侦察兵之类的。他是一个身体样本，瘦得像一条蛇，他的行动是如此的轻松和优雅，像一个舞者。他身上装饰着皮革、破布和各种物品的混合物。他身上有很多纹身或人体彩绘，尽管通过双筒望远镜很难分辨。
他一直在追踪蜥蜴，直到他的矛刺穿了一种蜥蜴，他才被他的猎物发现。这是一个壮观的场面，以至于我几乎忘记了我对流血的厌恶。然而，当他把这只可怜的野兽穿在身上时，我发现自己感到恶心。
此后不久，他迅速地收集了兽皮和肉，然后穿过山脊，以同样的速度和偷偷摸摸地进入。多么不同寻常的一天!
2275年4月18日。
在苦苦思索是否要跟随这位年轻侦察员的足迹之后，今天早上当我看到一个由50个部落成员组成的团体出现在峡谷下面时，我惊呆了。它们几乎肯定是游牧民，因为它们一直在监视附近的大角羊群。
这些人远不是简单的野蛮人，他们表现出深刻的同理心和相互支持，因为我注意到他们中有几个老人，他们都得到了同族人的扶持。当我在黎明时分注意到他们的营地时，他们已经开始了他们的日常工作，许多妇女和儿童聚集在一起，而成年男子则成群打猎。我看不出有什么争吵或内讧。与莫哈韦沙漠相比，这是一个可喜的变化。
虽然我只观察了他们一天，但我怀疑他们实行一夫多妻制。我希望明天一旦联系上他们，就能更好地了解他们的社会。
2275年4月19日。
这是许多第一次的一天。我还在兴奋得发抖呢!
今天早上，在格雷厄姆医生的指导下，我以稳健、从容的方式来到了营地。不出所料，是一群孩子首先发现了我。我不但不怕我，而且因为我的衣着和举止，立刻成了一个吸引人的对象。
几分钟后，我发现自己被部落的大部分人包围了，男男女女都一样，都在呆呆地看着我，小心翼翼地摸着我的外套。他们一直叫我"外国人"
虽然现在还不能确定，但我相信他们说的是一种混杂的英语，有很多西班牙语外来词。我能辨认出一些同源短语:“谁”、“在哪里”、母亲”、“父亲”，除此之外就没什么了。我试着咕哝“慢慢来”和“慢慢地”，但都无济于事。
不久，我被带到一群老人那里，他们可能是某种高级委员会。虽然交流有限，但我还是设法向他们传达了我的意图是和平的，我住在他们营地上方的一块岩石上。他们似乎对我即兴创作的手语很警惕，但却急切地在泥土上画象形文字。我回敬他说，我来自峡谷的北部，来自一个灯火通明的大城市。他们印象深刻。
这些人是我见过的最好客的主人。与长老们会面后，我立即被领进一个大帐篷，提供各种食物，其中大部分是肉。当我咽下烤大角面包时，我强迫自己微笑。最初的印象至关重要，所以我的饮食偏好可能要忍受一段时间了。我可以推断，如果我直接拒绝任何食物，那将是一种冒犯。
他们还为我提供了衣服，大概还有一个住的地方。在我接受教育的整个过程中，我从未预料到会遇到这样一群文明、友善的人。他们是我们物种中最好的。
2275年4月20日。
笨拙地披着兽皮，我开始模仿这里的部落居民的习惯和举止。我还没有确定它们的统称，不过我怀疑它与某种犬科动物的神有关。我对他们的语言做了大量的笔记，我希望在我结束我的学习之前能编出一本原始的词典。
我可以肯定地说，这是一个一夫多妻的社会。似乎每个男人都娶了多个妻子，而妻子的数量是这个平等主义文化中唯一可见的社会区别。
我猜想明天将是多事的一天--似乎有些人想带我去打猎。

ESP.ORIGINAL: Long Trip
ESP.TRADUIT: 长途旅行

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Sarah,
Got a long trip ahead now that we finished the job in Primm. Going to a place called Caruthers Canyon, south of Searchlight. Glanton says the settlers are aiming to clear out the local raiders, and they need our help.
Boss says we need to get moving. I'll write again when we get to the next town.
Tell the kids I love them. I can't wait to see you again.
Love, Ted
ESP.TRADUIT:
萨拉,
我们在普瑞姆完成了任务，还有很长的路要走。去一个叫卡拉瑟斯峡谷的地方，在探照灯营地南边。格兰顿说，定居者的目标是清除当地的掠夺者，他们需要我们的帮助。
老大说我们得走了。我们到下一个城镇时我再给你写信。
告诉孩子们我爱他们。我迫不及待想再见到你。
爱你的, - 泰德

ESP.ORIGINAL: Diary of Benjamin Hines, Vol. 2
ESP.TRADUIT: 《本杰明·海恩斯日记》，第二卷

ESP.ORIGINAL:
April 21, 2275. I killed a coyote this afternoon. I'm struggling to believe it after re-reading the words I've written. I accompanied the men thinking I would pick up some of their expressions, but it turned into something much different.
We left at dawn on an apparent gecko hunt. I felt so clumsy next to the other men, who moved with nary a sound, muscles taut and eyes alert. A stern-faced, older man handed me a crude spear before we departed. His expression intuited that rejecting the weapon would be umanly, so I accepted it without hesitation. Once we set off, I was barely able to keep up, my muscles cramping from the constant crouching. I was more focused on listening to their speech than watching for potential prey.
After an hour or so, the trio of hunters found a small group of geckos. I stayed close to the men as they inched closer to the noisy reptiles, readying their spears for action.
Right before they threw their weapons, the calm was disrupted by a cacophony of yelps and shrill cries. In an instant, a pack of coyotes descended on the geckos, scattering the tribe's quarry. The men reacted with startling speed, immediately flinging their spears toward geckos and coyotes alike. Before I gather my senses, the tribals had leapt from our position, brandishing war-clubs and smashing any animals within reach.
As they bludgeoned, kicked, and stabbed any wounded prey, I remained still, hoping it would end soon. The wailing of wounded animals pierced my very soul, even as I clamped my hands over my ears. I found myself rocking and praying for it to stop. As I waited, I noticed a strange smell nearby, so I slowly lowered my hands. That's when I heard the growling, and even the dripping saliva hit the bare sand. The coyote lunged just as I clasped the spear, knocking me on my side. I remember screaming as it latched onto my forearm, and it felt as if every muscle was going to be shorn from my bones.
I'm not sure what struck me. Perhaps it was the animal buried within my brain that screamed, "Fight! Live!" Something moved me, and without hesitation, I buried the spear into the coyote's throat. Even as its jugular spilled warm blood on my chest, it didn't let go. I punched, clawed, and bit, with a ferocity I never knew existed, but the animal would not release my limb.
It finally let go when the breathing stopped, and its eyes rolled backwards. Even with the adrenaline, I felt a strange feeling for the dead animal. Not pity... but respect.
Suffice to say the other men were impressed, even as I struggled to comprehend what they said. The pain was severe, and I'm still mortified of the thought of infection. It's a terrible way to die. Nonetheless, the tribals are tending my wounds. A young woman with dark eyes has been particularly attentive, and I must admit that a mere glance has more effect than any analgesic in a doctor's bag. Perhaps it's the healing powder getting to me. I think her name is "Flor". I hope I dream about Flor tonight.
This has been the most amazing day of my life.
April 28, 2275. I'm ashamed to admit I've neglected my journal for an entire week, but what a week it has been!
After rapidly convalescing, I took part in some crude ceremony celebrating my kill. While I'm still uneasy about the entire affair, I must admit that the tribe's adulation and fascination is exciting. I've made a litany of linguistic breakthroughs, all documented in my notes. They call themselves the "Sand Wolves", a rather forbidding name for such a peaceful people. They have taken to calling me "Landido wit lanz", something that I believes corresponds to "Lays with spear". It could have been worse.
In addition to documenting their language, I live among the Sand Wolves and share their duties, as well as their leisure. We hunt all morning, rest in the afternoon, and then recreate in the evenings. My body is already adapting to the demands of daily exertion; I can feel my sinew growing tighter, and I don't lose my breath as often. I have even grown to enjoy the hunt, even though I still struggle with the slaying of innocent creatures. However, the Sand Wolves kill only what they need, and they use almost everything from the carcass.
As much as I enjoy the comradery of the morning hunt, the best part of my day is the return, when we stroll into camp, with a bloody creature in tow, and we are met with the eyes of the camp's women. When Flor's eyes meet mine, I feel my muscles tense, and my very spine quakes for fear of disappointing her. One of the fellow men has noticed my apprehension about Flor, so he ribs me in good spirits. He is my first friend here, Walks with Thunder.
Thunder (as I call him) has been instrumental in my adaption to tribal life. Just as I am curious about the Sand Wolves, so is he unfailingly fascinated by my crude descriptions of the outside world. I hope I can persuade him to stay here. At least he has done me the honor of painting my face. I imagine I would have mucked it up royally if left to my own devices. There is so much to record, so much to learn.
I will try to be more consistent in my journal entries, but I make no promises. I will promise to speak with Flor tomorrow. That is what I'll tell myself.
May 16, 2275. I have been delinquent in my entries, but what news I have to share! I have been accepted into the tribe, made an equal among the Sand Wolves! I now share the same rights, privileges, and obligations of every man. Including marriage.
I did not expect this, to be candid. I was engaged in the routine of hunting, learning the language, making awkward glances at Flor, when Thunder finally spoke to me about my status. He informed me that I was always a welcome guest, but if I had any ambition of courting Flor, I would have to be adopted by a family.
I was surprised, and not a little uncertain about this. I have responsibilities outside the canyon, with the Followers. With my findings, I can publish work that would cement my place in academia, perhaps even become a professor. This weighs on me every night, but Flor makes me think insane thoughts - thoughts unbecoming for a "civilized" man.
June 24, 2275. What a strange, transformative month this has been. The courtship began very well - so well in fact, that Flor and I are now married! It feels strange writing it - I am a married man now. Mr. Spear, if you will!
Our initial meetings involved a great deal of miscommunication, but it was clear that we couldn't stand being away from each other for very long. My grasp of their language is progressing quickly, so we were able to exchange one important expression, "Tou Amo" - I love you.
Flor is an amazing woman. I catch myself just staring at her, indifferent to the rest of the universe. The dark hair and eyes, olive skin, the contours of her body, her lips. That will conclude this entry.
July 28, 2275. Time for another late entry from Mr. Spear.
Flor and I are settling into our life together, though I worry about our long-term prospects. Could I ever ask her to uproot from this place and follow me to the hell of New Vegas? I don't know if she could take the culture shock. More importantly, I don't know if I want to return now. I have obligations to the Followers, my family. I can't leave that behind, can I?
My skill with the spear and the Sand Wolves' language are both progressing rapidly. Yesterday I felled Bighorner bull and managed to assist in the field dressing without getting queasy. Perhaps I've grown inured to it through force of habit, but it's almost mechanical now. I'm starting to enjoy the hunt more than my research. What would Dr. Graham say?
August 10, 2275. Flor is pregnant. I'm going to be a father!
I was worried that she was growing ill, with the regurgitation and nausea, but it became clear when some of the older women began winking at me and whispering, "Embaragnant" - pregnant. I came here expecting to learn a language and write a book, and now I have a family. Sometimes I wonder if it's just a dream, however cliched that may be - just a weird, unexpected spasm of the imagination. But it's real.
As happy as we both are, I can't help but feel uncertain about this. Why should Flor suffer through a painful, risky labor out here in the wilds? At least in New Vegas, I could ensure her safety, and that of the child. There are so many risks, so many dangers. This is what keeps me up at night, even as I enjoy the respect and congratulations from the tribals.
I'll have to make a decision soon, and it will change the rest of my life - and my family's.
August 13, 2275. I've decided to stay. I've found a strange peace with this life, with these people. They are my family now. Whatever happens, I know these people will support me.
I have a functional grasp on the language now, thanks to Flor's patience and undying instruction. In exchange, I've teaching her how to read, write and speak English.
Unfortunately, I only brought a dictionary, Moby Dick, and The Odyssey. Ironically, she has warmed to Homer's fantastical tale, but Melville's work is just too alien for her. It's hard for me to describe the ocean when I've never even seen it myself. Jealous deities, mythical heroism, sex, and cunning are easy for her to grasp. An obsessive quest to destroy a single animal is a little harder to explain, much less the concept of hunting for profit, not sustenance. It might be best to let Moby Dick wait.
October 26, 2275. Glancing over my old entries, I realize that I often scribbled notes only when great events transpired. Not so today. I just feel like reflecting on my decision.
Flor's pregnancy is just starting to show, and she's glowing, really glowing. I always dismissed that description as mawkish crap, but it's true. It's hard on her when the tribe moves, but everyone helps out.
I'm going to be leaving her for a few days while I go with a group of scouts to track a Bighorner herd. Thunder has been wanting to show me the "Cueva Metalica", whatever that means.
ESP.TRADUIT:
2275年4月21日。
我今天下午杀了一只郊狼。重读我写的那些话后，我很难相信。我陪着他们，以为能学到他们的一些表情，但结果却大不相同。
我们拂晓出发，显然是去捕猎蜥蜴。和其他男人比起来，我觉得自己笨手笨脚的，他们一动也不出声，肌肉紧绷，眼神敏锐。在我们离开之前，一个面无表情的老人递给我一支粗糙的长矛。他的表情直觉地告诉我，拒绝这个武器会很不合群，所以我毫不犹豫地接受了。我们一出发，我就几乎跟不上了，我的肌肉因为一直蹲伏而抽筋。我更专注于听它们说话，而不是观察潜在的猎物。
大约一小时后，这三个猎人发现了一小群蜥蜴。当他们慢慢靠近那些吵吵嚷嚷的爬行动物时，我留在他们身边，准备拿长矛战斗。
就在他们扔出武器之前，一阵刺耳的尖叫声打破了平静。刹那间，一群郊狼向蜥蜴扑了过来，驱散了他们的猎物。这些人以惊人的速度做出了反应，立即把矛掷向蜥蜴和郊狼。还没等我回过神来，那些部落民就从我们的位置上跳了下来，挥舞着战棍，打烂了身边的任何动物。
当他们用棍棒、脚踢、刺伤任何受伤的猎物时，我保持不动，希望它能很快结束。当我用手捂着耳朵的时候，受伤动物的哀号声刺穿了我的灵魂。我发现自己在摇摆，祈祷它停止。在等待的时候，我注意到附近有一股奇怪的气味，于是我慢慢把手放下来。就在那时，我听到了咆哮，甚至口水滴到了光秃秃的沙滩上。就在我抓住矛的时候，那只郊狼猛冲过来，把我撞翻在地。我记得当它咬住我的前臂时，我尖叫起来，感觉好像我的骨头上的每一块肌肉都要被剪掉。
我不知道是什么影响了我。也许是埋在我大脑里的动物本能在尖叫:“战斗!”活着!”有什么东西打动了我，我毫不犹豫地把矛刺进了郊狼的喉咙。即使它的颈静脉把温热的血液洒在我的胸口，它也没有松开。我又打又抓又咬，我从未意识到它如此凶猛，但它就是不放开我的四肢。
当呼吸停止时，它终于放开了，眼睛向后转。尽管肾上腺素激增，我还是对这只死去的动物有一种奇怪的感觉。不遗憾...但尊重。
我只能说，其他人都被打动了，尽管我还在努力理解他们在说什么。疼痛很厉害，我现在一想到感染就感到羞愧。这种死法太可怕了。尽管如此，部落民正在治疗我的伤口。一位有着黑眼睛的年轻女士对我特别殷勤，我必须承认，仅仅是一瞥就比医生包里的任何止痛药都管用。也许是治愈粉影响了我。我想她的名字是“弗洛尔”。我希望今晚能梦到弗洛尔。
这是我一生中最棒的一天。
2275年4月28日。
我很惭愧地承认，整整一个星期我都忘了写日记，但这是多么难熬的一个星期啊!
在迅速康复后，我参加了一些庆祝我的杀戮的粗劣仪式。虽然我仍然对整个事件感到不安，但我必须承认，这个部落的奉承和迷恋令人兴奋。我在语言上取得了一连串的突破，都记录在我的笔记里。他们称自己为“沙狼”，对这样一个和平的民族来说，这是一个相当令人生畏的名字。他们都称我为“机智的兰第多”，我认为这相当于“拿着矛的乐事”。它本来可能更糟。
除了记录他们的语言，我还和沙狼生活在一起，分享他们的职责和闲暇。我们上午打猎，下午休息，晚上消遣。我的身体已经适应了每天的消耗;我能感觉到我的肌肉越来越紧，我也不像以前那样经常喘不过气来了。我甚至开始喜欢打猎了，尽管我还在和杀害无辜的生物斗争。然而，沙狼只杀死它们需要的东西，它们几乎用掉所有的尸体。
虽然我很享受早上打猎时的战友情谊，但我一天中最精彩的部分是返回时，当我们漫步进入营地，带着一个个血淋淋的动物，我们遇到了营地的女人的眼睛。当弗洛尔的目光与我相遇时，我感到自己的肌肉紧张起来，我的脊椎因为害怕让她失望而颤抖。一个同伴注意到我对弗洛尔的担忧，所以他逗我开心。他是我在这里的第一个朋友，雷霆万钧
雷(我这样称呼他)对我适应部落生活起了很大作用。就像我对沙狼很好奇一样，他也一直被我对外面世界的粗糙描述所吸引。我希望我能说服他留在这里。至少他给了我面子，在我脸上画了画。我想如果让我自己做主，我会把事情搞得一团糟的。
有太多要记录，太多要学习。
我会尽量在日记中保持一致，但我不敢保证。我答应明天和弗洛尔谈谈。这就是我要告诉自己的。
2275年5月16日。
我已经拖欠了我的记录，但我有消息要分享!我已经被部落接纳了，成为了沙狼中的一员!我现在与每个人享有同样的权利、特权和义务。包括婚姻。
坦率地说，我没想到会这样。我忙着打猎，学习语言，尴尬地瞥了弗洛尔一眼，这时雷终于告诉了我我的身份。他告诉我，我一直是受欢迎的客人，但如果我有追求弗洛尔的念头，我就必须移居到一个家族。
我很惊讶，对此也很确定。我要负责峡谷外的事，和天启追随者们一起。有了这些发现，我就可以发表作品，巩固我在学术界的地位，甚至可能成为一名教授。这每天晚上都压在我身上，但弗洛尔让我想到一些疯狂的想法--那些想法不适合一个“文明人”。
2275年6月24日。
这是一个多么奇怪、充满变革的月份啊。求爱开始得很顺利--事实上非常顺利，我和弗洛尔现在已经结婚了!写这封信感觉很奇怪--我现在是已婚男人了。长矛先生，如果你愿意的话!
我们最初的会面有很多误解，但很明显，我们无法忍受离开对方太久。我对他们的语言掌握得很快，所以我们能够交换一个重要的表达，“tpu Amo”--我爱你。
弗洛尔是个了不起的女人。我发现自己只是盯着她看，就会对宇宙的其他一切都漠不关心。黑色的头发和眼睛，橄榄色的皮肤，她身体的轮廓，她的嘴唇。这就是一切了。
2275年7月28日。
长矛先生又迟到了。
弗洛尔和我已经适应了我们的生活，尽管我担心我们的长远前景。我能让她离开这里跟我去新维加斯吗?我不知道她是否能承受文化冲击。更重要的是，我不知道我现在还想不想回去。我对天启追随者和我的家人有责任。我不能把它抛在脑后，不是吗?
我的矛术和沙狼的语言都进步很快。昨天我砍倒了大角羊，还在现场帮忙剥皮，没有感到恶心。也许我已经习惯了它，但现在它几乎是机械的。比起我的研究，我更喜欢打猎了。格雷厄姆医生会怎么说?
2275年8月10日。
弗洛尔怀孕了。我要当爸爸了!
我担心她的反胃和恶心是因为生病，但当一些年长的妇女开始向我眨眼并低声说:“怀孕了”时，我才明白过来。我来这里是想学一门语言和写一本书，现在我有了一个家。有时我在想，这是否只是一场梦，不管它有多老套--只是一种奇怪的、意想不到的想象的痉挛。但这是真实的。
虽然我们俩都很幸福，但我还是忍不住感到不确定。弗洛尔为什么要在这片荒野里忍受痛苦而又危险的分娩?至少在新维加斯，我能保证她和孩子的安全。有太多的风险，太多的危险。这让我彻夜难眠，尽管我享受着来自部落的尊重和祝贺。
我很快就要做出决定了，它将改变我的余生，以及我的家庭。
2275年8月13日。
我决定留下来。
我找到了一种奇怪的平静生活，和这些人在一起。他们现在是我的家人。不管发生什么，我知道这些人都会支持我。
多亏了弗洛尔的耐心和不朽的指导，我现在对这门语言有了功能性的掌握。作为交换，我教她读、写和说英语。
不幸的是，我只带了一本字典，《白鲸记》和《奥德赛》。讽刺的是，她喜欢荷马的奇幻故事，但是梅尔维尔的作品对她来说太陌生了。我自己都没见过海洋，很难描述它。嫉妒的神、神话中的英雄主义、性和狡猾对她来说都是容易掌握的。对消灭一只动物的执着追求很难解释，更不用说为了利润而狩猎的概念，而不是为了生存。也许最好还是让莫比-迪克等一等。
2275年10月26日。
浏览我的旧记录，我意识到我经常潦草地笔记，只有当重大事件发生。今天的情况不一样了。我只是想反思一下我的决定。
弗洛尔刚开始怀孕，她容光焕发，真的容光焕发。我一直认为这种描述是恶心的废话，但这是真的。部落搬家对她来说很艰难，但大家都在帮忙。
我要离开她几天，我要和一群侦察兵去追踪大角羊群。雷一直想给我看"金属洞穴"不知道那是什么意思。

ESP.ORIGINAL: Diary of Benjamin Hines, Vol. 3
ESP.TRADUIT: 《本杰明·海恩斯日记》，第三卷

ESP.ORIGINAL:
October 30, 2275. The hunt went well, but it was not a good trip.
Thunder showed me the cave, and I was expecting to see a shrine or holy place. Instead, I led into a lower cavern, where my torch was the only source of light. With an innocent smile, Thunder pointed at the object of fascination - a silver vein.
At first I was uncertain, but after examining it closely, my stomach sank. To the Sand Wolves, it's a novelty - to the outside world, it's reason to move in and take over the canyon. Even the hint of silver would prompt miners and prospectors to dig, strip, and search every corner of this place. A find this large would attract entire companies. It would destroy the tribe.
Poor Thunder couldn't understand my dismay, even though I tried to warn him of the danger. I'm going to hold a meeting with some of the elders tonight, try to convince them to let me seal off the cave.
Flor tries to comfort me, even though she can't grasp what's at stake. "Solo metalo," she says - it's only metal. I wish that were true.
October 31, 2275. After much deliberation, the elders ended up supporting my plan, though most were still mystified by my apprehension. I'd like to hug Dr. Graham for insisting that I pack a tiny bit of plastic explosives. Though I vehemently resisted, he demanded it, telling me that it could come in useful in odd situations. I could kiss that man for his foresight.
Flor is struggling to understand why I'm undertaking this mission, though I try to console her by promising it is for the good of the tribe. It is never easy leaving her, even for a day. At least Thunder will accompany me.
November 5, 2275. The mission failed. It wasn't because of the explosive, but the fact that I was too late, and I hesitated.
When Thunder and I reached a bluff overlooking the cave, we noticed two prospectors encamped near the entrance. I'm half-ashamed to write this, but my initial reaction was to kill them and dispose of the bodies. Thunder and I watched them for a half-hour, and I could only imagine how to kill them, then how I would explain it to the tribe. Murder is anathema to them, with any perpetrators suffering permanent banishment. Thunder told me there hasn't been a homicide in over a decade. They wouldn't understand if killed these two strangers, men they would consider guests. They don't know what's coming.
When we saw the men enter the cave with lanterns and pickaxes, it finally sunk in. Caruthers Canyon and the Sand Wolves would never be the same again. I whispered, "Wamin goes" to Thunder and we slipped away.
November 6, 2275. I've failed yet again.
The leading elder, Sings with Bones, is determined to welcome the prospectors into the canyon with the same courtesy they showed me. He and the others argued that they must treat all newcomers the same as me, or they will have broken their most sacred laws. They do not appreciate the avarice and violence of the outsiders. They tried to console me, told me that I was merely listening to bad spirits, that men don't do the things I describe.
I've been instructed to stay here while a small delegation goes to meet the prospectors. I am considering absconding with Flor, but I doubt she could manage the arduous trip in her condition.
Maybe I'm worrying about nothing. They could be New Canaanites or just decent people. I can hope.
November 10, 2275. The delegation failed to return, so I've been appointed to lead a scouting party and ascertain their fate.
I have picked a group of young hunters, all of them strong and capable with weapons. I'll have eight men armed with spears , clubs, and knives. They still don't understand that their friends are likely dead or captured, maybe even enslaved. It's simply incomprehensible for them. I don't how they'll react. I don't know how I'll react. I don't know if I can kill a man, but maybe it's not too different from an animal. That's what we are, after all. Just dumb fucking animals.
I'm going to say goodbye to Flor again, but it's different. I may not come back.
November 15, 2275. The prospectors killed the delegation. We killed the prospectors.
We found their camp at night, and we noticed the five emissaries were all bound and gagged, and looked to have been tortured. Thunder and the other hunters appeared uncertain, even frightened. It was the first time I'd seen them like that. I gave them a signal, then began creeping towards the slumbering outsiders.
I finally reached the first prospector, a bearded, rough fellow who looked to be in his 30's. I grasped the knife in my hand, but waited. I looked over at Thunder, who was inspecting the captured tribals. He gave me a look that I'll never forget, then motioned that their throats had been slit. In that moment, he understood, and so did I.
I clamped my hand over the prospector's mouth, then began stabbing him in the throat, imagining him to be that coyote that attacked me months before. He thrashed and grasped at my arms, but I was too strong for him, too strong by far. Once he faded, I motioned the hunters to grab the other prospector.
They held him down by the fire, and I stood over him, clutching a heavy war club. He screamed out his friend's name, then began cursing all of us as filthy savages. He yelled, "You're fucking done, you goddamn savages, they're coming, and you can't stop them!"
He grew quiet when I whispered to him, "Who else knows?"
He hesitated, then said, "Nobody, I'm just talking crazy. Please let me go, I'll never come back, I promise!"
When the war club shattered his knee, he thrashed and screeched, "Fucking savages! Fuck you! Fuck you!", but the men didn't let go.
I said again, "Who else knows? Tell me, and it will be quick."
"Fuck you," he said, then spit in my face.
The war club came down so hard on his genitals, and I thought he might go into shock and pass out. But he just screamed, turned white, and began sobbing.
I whispered softly in his ear, "Who else knows?"
He continued sobbing and coughing, then blurted out, "A courier. A courier sent to the East California Mining Company. We just wanted to know where the rest of the silver was, and they wouldn't say. That's all."
I gave a look to Thunder, and then he and the other hunters let the man go. He started crawling away, but they were on him with their war clubs. It didn't take long. We buried them all, sealed the mine, then left. Thunder didn't say a word on the entire trip back.
I could hardly look the rest of the Sand Wolves in the eyes when we returned. When I told the elders what happened, they grew pale, and some began crying. I explained what happened to the delegation, and that we were all in danger now. I implored them to lead the tribe away from the canyon, find a different hunting ground - or prepare to fight. They would have none of it. They merely said the gods would judge us, and that we would never speak of it again. It was meant to shame us, but I don't feel shame - only sadness... and fear for what's to come.
I held on to Flor all evening. She spoke softly and tried to comfort me, running her fingers across my back as she whispered in my ear. She's all that matters now. I don't know if I can save this tribe.
January 14, 2276. They're here.
I thought the prospector might have lied. It had been close to two months, and things within camp had almost returned to normal. However, I knew that rotten animal had told the truth when I spotted the camp yesterday.
I was leading a hunting party near the silver cave when I noticed the smoke plumes across the ridge. I peeked over the rocks, hoping it was just a group of lost travelers. Hindsight renders that notion doubly idiotic. There was a fortified encampment, guarded by at least twenty armed men, probably mercenaries. There were several brahmin loaded with supplies, and enough materials to lay the foundations for a town. Inside the perimeter, workers were busy moving supplies into the mine, filling sandbags, and setting up tents. It was the beginning of a settlement.
I motioned the other hunters to ease away from the ridge, and we set out for camp. Tonight I will advise the elders on a course of action.
January 15, 2276. The poor fools are going to tear this tribe apart. I tried to warn them, even considered fighting them, but it would be useless. I can't jeopardize my place in the tribe with Flor so far along.
I told the elders about what I saw, and then told them we had several options: 1. Run. 2. Fight a guerrilla campaign. 3. Use our overwhelming numbers to snuff out the town in its infancy.
The elders would have none of it. They descended into a harangue about judgment and forgiveness, scolding me for my past actions and the mere recommendation of violence. They told me that I must purify my spirit or face banishment. It was a severe reprimand by the standards of the Sand Wolves.
They're going to invite the mercenaries and miners to our camp, in the hopes of demonstrating the Sand Wolves' peaceful intentions, and make an appeal to share the canyon. They believe they can trade metal for hunting rights - a charming notion. What they're going to do is jeopardize everyone in the tribe, including Flor. I won't let that happen.
I've already spoken with Thunder and some of the other hunters who were with me that night. We're moving our families and anyone who'll listen to another camp site, elders be damned. We're going to have to be quick. If we're discovered, we risk open condemnation from the council, which would be comparable to excommunication for everyone involved. The delegation will be returning in two days, presumably with the miners in tow. We'll leave at night.
ESP.TRADUIT:
2275年10月30日。
狩猎进行得很顺利，但这不是一次愉快的旅行。
雷带我去了山洞，我原以为会看到一个神龛或圣地。相反，我进入了一个较低的洞穴，我的手电筒是那里唯一的光源。雷带着天真的微笑，指着迷人的对象--银脉。
一开始我不确定，但仔细检查后，我的胃下沉了。对沙狼来说，这是一件新奇的事，但对外界来说，这是他们迁入并占领峡谷的理由。即使是银矿的蛛丝马迹也会促使矿工和勘探者去挖掘、开采和搜索这个地方的每一个角落。这么大的发现将吸引整个公司。这会摧毁这个部落。
可怜的雷不能理解我的沮丧，尽管我试图警告他危险。我今晚要和一些长老开个会，试着说服他们让我把山洞封起来。
弗洛尔试图安慰我，尽管她不知道什么才是最重要的。“只是金属，”她说它只是金属。我希望真的是这样。
2275年10月31日。
经过深思熟虑，长老们最终还是支持我的计划，但大多数人还是对我的顾虑感到不解。我真想抱抱格雷厄姆医生。因为他坚持让我带了一些塑料炸药。尽管我当时强烈反对，他还是要求了，并告诉我，在一些奇怪的情况下，它可能会有用。我真想亲吻那个人的远见。
弗洛尔不明白我为什么要执行这项任务，尽管我试图安慰她保证这是为了部落的利益。离开她从来都不是一件容易的事，哪怕是一天。至少还有雷陪我。
2275年的11月5日。
任务失败了。不是因为爆炸，而是因为我来得太晚了，我犹豫了。
当雷和我走到俯瞰洞穴的悬崖上时，我们注意到有两名勘探者在洞口扎营。我写这篇文章有点惭愧，但我的第一反应是杀了他们，然后把尸体处理掉。雷和我看了他们半个小时，我只能想象如何杀死他们，然后如何向部落解释。谋杀是他们所痛恨的，任何行凶者都将被永久驱逐。雷告诉我已经有十多年没发生过谋杀案了。他们不会理解如果杀了这两个陌生人，他们会把他们当做客人。他们不知道接下来会发生什么。
当我们看到那些人提着灯笼和鹤嘴锄进入山洞时，我的心终于沉了下去。卡拉瑟斯峡谷和沙狼将不再是以前的样子。我低声对雷霆说"我们走"然后我们就溜走了。
2275年11月6日。
我又失败了。
领头的长老，用骨头唱歌，决心用他们对我的礼貌来欢迎勘探者进入峡谷。他和其他人争论说，他们必须像对待我一样对待所有新来的人，否则他们就会违反他们最神圣的法律。他们不欣赏外人的贪婪和暴力。他们试图安慰我，说我只是在听坏人说话，说男人不会做我描述的那种事。
我奉命待在这里一个去见勘探者的小代表团里。我在考虑和弗洛尔一起逃走，但我怀疑她的身体状况能否经受得住这次艰苦的旅行。
也许我什么都不担心。他们可能是新迦南人，也可能都是正派的人。我希望。
2275年11月10日。
代表团没能回来，所以我被指派带领一支侦察队来确定他们的命运。
我挑选了一群年轻的猎人，他们都很强壮，有武器。我要八个人带着长矛，棍棒和刀。他们仍然不明白，他们的朋友可能已经死了或被捕了，甚至可能被奴役了。这对他们来说简直不可思议。我不知道他们会作何反应。我不知道我会有什么反应。我不知道我能不能杀死一个人，但也许这和动物没有太大区别。毕竟，这就是我们。只是些愚蠢的动物。
我又要和弗洛尔说再见了，但情况不一样。我可能不会回来了。
2275年11月15日。
勘探者杀死了代表团。我们杀了勘探者。
我们在晚上发现了他们的营地，我们注意到那五名使者都被绑住了嘴，看上去受到了折磨。雷和其他猎人们显得犹豫不决，甚至有些害怕。这是我第一次看到他们那样。我给了他们一个信号，然后蹑手蹑脚地向熟睡的外来者走去。
我终于找到了第一个勘探者，他是一个留着胡子、看上去30多岁的粗人。我握着手里的刀，但犹豫着。我看了看雷电，他正在视察被俘的部落。他看了我一眼，我永远不会忘记，然后示意割开他们的喉咙。那一刻，他明白了，我也明白了。
我用手紧紧捂住勘探者的嘴，然后开始用刀刺他的喉咙，把他想象成几个月前袭击我的那只狼。他挣扎着抓住我的胳膊，但我对他来说太强壮了，实在是太强壮了。他一断气，我就示意猎人们抓住另一个勘探者。
他们把他按在火边，我站在他旁边，手里握着一根沉重的战争棍棒。他尖叫着喊出他朋友的名字，然后开始咒骂我们，说我们都是肮脏的野蛮人。他喊道:“你们他妈的完蛋了，你们这些该死的野蛮人，他们来了，你们无法阻止他们!”
当我小声问他“还有谁知道?”
他犹豫了一下，然后说:“谁也没有，我只是在胡说八道。”请放了我吧，我再也不回来了，我保证!”
当他的膝盖被棍棒击碎时，他抽搐着，尖叫着，“该死的野蛮人!去你妈的!去你的!”但是我们不松手。
我又说:“还有谁知道?告诉我，会很快的。”
“去你妈的，”他说着，朝我脸上吐了口唾沫。
战棍狠狠的打在他的生殖器上，我以为他会休克昏迷过去。但他只是尖叫，脸色苍白，并开始抽泣。
我在他耳边轻声说:“还有谁知道呢?”
他继续抽泣和咳嗽，然后脱口而出:“邮差。一名邮差被派往东加利福尼亚矿业公司。我们只是想知道剩下的银矿在哪，他们不会说，就这样。”
我看了雷一眼，然后他和其他猎人放开他。他开始试图爬走，但他们用战棍打死了他。没花多长时间。我们把他们都埋了，封了矿，然后离开了。雷一路上一句话也没说。
当我们回来的时候，我几乎无法直视其他的沙狼成员。当我告诉长老们发生的事情时，他们脸色发白，有些人开始哭了。我解释了代表团的事，我们现在都处于危险之中。我恳求他们带领部落离开峡谷，找一个不同的猎场，或者准备战斗。他们不接受，他们只是说，诸神会审判我们，我们再也不会提起这件事。这是为了让我们感到羞耻，但我不觉得羞耻，只有悲伤......以及对未来的恐惧。
我整晚都抱着弗洛尔。她温柔地说着话，试图安慰我，她的手指在我的背上滑过，她在我耳边低语。现在她才是最重要的。我不知道我能不能拯救这个部落。
2276年1月14日。
他们来了。
刚开始我以为勘探者可能撒谎了。将近两个月过去了，营地内的情况几乎恢复了正常。然而，当我昨天看到营地时，我知道那只腐烂的动物说的是实话。
我正带领一支狩猎队靠近银矿洞，这时我注意到山脊上冒出缕缕烟雾。我从岩石上往外看，希望那只是一群迷路的旅行者。事后看来，这种想法显得更加愚蠢。那里有一个戒备森严的营地，由至少二十名武装人员，可能是雇佣兵看守。有几个婆罗门带着补给品和足够建造一座城镇的材料。在矿区周边，工人们正忙着将物资运进矿井，装沙袋，搭建帐篷。这一个定居点的开始。
我示意其他猎人离开山脊，然后我们出发去营地。今晚我将向长老们提出行动方案。
2276年1月15日。
这些可怜的傻瓜要把这个部落害死了。我试图警告他们，甚至想过和他们打一架，但都没用。到目前为止，我不能危及我和弗洛尔在部落里的地位。
我把我所看到的告诉了长老们，然后告诉他们我们有几个选择:
1. 跑。 2. 打一场游击战争。 3.利用我们压倒性的人数把这个城市扼杀在萌芽期。
长老们可不会同意。他们转而大谈裁决和宽恕，斥责我过去的行为和只想着使用暴力。他们告诉我，我必须净化我的灵魂，否则将面临放逐。以沙狼的标准来看，这是一次严厉的谴责。
他们会邀请雇佣兵和矿工来我们的营地，希望展示沙狼的和平意图，并呼吁分享峡谷。他们相信他们可以用金属来换取狩猎权--这是一个迷人的想法。他们会害死这个部落里的每个人，包括弗洛尔，我不会让这种事发生的。
我已经和雷和那晚和我在一起的其他猎人谈过了。我们准备搬家并带上任何愿意去另一个营地的人，老人家都见鬼去吧。我们得快点了。如果我们被发现了，我们就要冒着被委员会公开谴责的风险，这就相当于所有参与其中的人都被逐出教会。
代表团将在两天后返回，估计矿工们也会随行。我们晚上就走。

ESP.ORIGINAL: HANDS OFF!
ESP.TRADUIT: 手老实点！

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Hi, if you're reading this message you've probably done two things:
1. Killed off the entire pack of coyotes living here. (You bastard.) 2. Managed to get into my secret beverage stash that I've so carefully hidden here.
If so, allow me to give you a word of advice.
DON'T. TOUCH. MY. DRINKS.
I am deadly serious. If you so much as take a sip from my precious tequila I will hunt you down and GRIND YOUR EYEBALLS INTO PASTE.
Don't think I'm joking, do you know how hard it was for me to get all this in this den in the first place? I've done some bad stuff in my lifetime but the things I had to do to get past these coyotes, just, god, I don't wanna think about it.
Don't touch my drinks.
-Carolyn
ESP.TRADUIT:
嗨，如果你正在阅读这条信息，你可能已经做了两件事:
1. 杀死了住在这里的整群郊狼。(你这个混蛋)。
2. 成功进入了我小心翼翼藏在这里的秘密饮料库。
如果是这样，请允许我给你一句忠告。
别！动！我！的！饮料！
我是非常认真的。如果你敢喝一口我珍贵的龙舌兰我就把你抓起来把你的眼珠子磨成浆糊。
别以为我在开玩笑，你知道我一开始有多难把这些东西弄到这个小房间里吗？我这辈子做过一些坏事但我必须做些事才能摆脱那些郊狼，天啊，我不想再想了。
别碰我的饮料。
- 卡洛琳

ESP.ORIGINAL: Diary of Benjamin Hines, Vol. 4
ESP.TRADUIT: 《本杰明·海恩斯日记》，第四卷

ESP.ORIGINAL:
January 17, 2276. Flor is safe, along with some of the families. Aside from that, there is no good news. It is a dark day for the Sand Wolves.
This morning, I and a few of the dissident men (Thunder included), made a point to observe the welcoming of the newcomers to our camp. We chose a distant, well-hidden bluff overlooking the site.
At first, I thought my fears might be for naught, as the entire delegation returned, apparently unharmed, with ten men accompanying them. All of the elders and senior tribals emerged to greet them, with all the pomp that they could muster, offering the guests food, clothes, and jewelry. The men seemed amicable enough.
However, soon after they began meeting, I overhead one of the men asking, "Are these your leaders?", then began motioning and drawing in the sand. For a moment, I was taken back to my own first encounter. Within a few minutes, the men were confident they were in the company of the tribe's elders. That's when they killed them.
It's clear they were mercenaries, based on how they handled the weapons. They were quick and efficient. First they shot the six elders, who had nary a moment to react. Then the screams and panic set in, and the real slaughter began in earnest. The men unloaded entire magazines with automatic weapons at close range, indiscriminately shooting men, women, and children. It was as if I was forced to watch my own family butchered in slow-motion, right before me. They were like helpless, timid animals, some praying and pleading, incapable of understanding. The men just laughed and continued firing. A handful of tribal men were moved to action, with one even wounding a mercenary with a spear. It didn't matter, though - they were summarily gunned down.
Thunder also watched, and began sobbing. I held him, made sure he remained quiet, but I shared his grief, and his anger. When the men finally left, that is all I felt - pure rage. Now I know why men hate.
January 18, 2276. Not all of us died yesterday. Many fled to safety, and we have been busy collecting the traumatized survivors and leading them to our new camp. There is so much pain and uncertainty. We have no leadership. They look to Thunder and I now. We will have to fight.
January 21, 2276. We have buried all the dead, and now we're preparing for the reckoning. Most of them have killed animals, so it is not hard to teach them to kill men. You hit them here, cut them there, smash this, slice that. They learn quickly.
It is just Thunder and I now - we are the council. We have decided to fight in an irregular fashion, based on my advice. I know very little of warfare aside from books, but we must press our advantages - familiarity with terrain, stealth, resourcefulness, and commitment. I do remember that - the spoils belong to the most committed.
We must procure firearms. Tomorrow I will lead a scouting party and try to set up an ambush near the entrance to the canyon.
Flor cries a lot now, and it is not because of the pregnancy. I never wanted for her to experience this pain, this worry. Perhaps I should have left and taken her with me.
It's too late now.
January 23, 2276. The ambush was a stunning success. It's amazing how inattentive caravan guards can be when they're close to their destination. We caught them at dawn, and the Sand Wolves performed brilliantly. Without a noise, we launched a hail of spears at the guards, killing two almost instantly. As the travelers screamed and panicked, we all sprang from cover and fell on them with clubs, knives, and hatchets. One of the young warriors took a bullet to the chest, but we suffered no other casualties.
We killed all the settlers, save one child. He will be raised with ours.
January 25, 2276. They are taking to weapons training with amazing alacrity. I thank Dr. Graham for mandating rudimentary marksmanship lessons, even if I was indifferent at the time.
Sometimes I doubt myself, though. Today I taught women and teenage boys how to operate killing machines and the best way to stab a man.
Is this how Edward Sallow felt?
January 30, 2276. We were victorious today, and it felt good.
Yesterday, one of the scouts spotted a mercenary patrol near the old encampment. They were well-armed, with combat armor and grenade launchers. It didn't save them.
We approached their camp at night and noticed they were wise enough to post two sentries. Two agile warriors disposed of the clumsy bastards without a peep. Then we moved in without a noise, weapons bared. It was over in less than a minute, without a shot fired. They brought their best, and we destroyed them without a single loss.
Maybe we can keep this canyon after all.
February 15, 2276. After we butchered that mercenary patrol, the canyon remained quiet for several weeks. Scouts reported caravan traffic to the town, but little else. Apparently they're building walls. We must made quite an impression.
Unfortunately, there has been a difference of opinion between Thunder and I of late. He is advocating a full-scale assault on the town, arguing that our new firepower will give us an edge. I refuse, as we are still few in number, with no armor, and insufficient training for such a bloody operation. It's one thing to ambush caravans, and something else entirely to coordinate an attack on a well-defended position. I fear we would be routed, and never really recover. The tribe is still in a fragile state.
Flor is close now. She continues to worry for me, just as I worry for the tribe. It has changed so much since the attack on the camp. Bravery and scalps are now the measure of manhood, with differences settled by single combat. We are close-knit, but there is tension born from the exposure to danger and combat. Most of us are killers now.
February 18, 2276. Thunder has taken our disagreement to the general council, and we must present our case to the entire tribe. I fear that he will stir them into a frenzy, and then our fate will be sealed. I will speak of our need for patience, to bide our time and continue striking when and where they least expect it. This is not an appealing route, but it is sustainable.
February 19, 2276. It is decided - every able-bodied warrior will participate in the attack on the mining town. I have been charged with drawing up a plan for what is probably an impossible task. I am going to leave Flor a widow, most likely.
Tomorrow I will lead a reconnaissance mission to evaluate the town's defenses. I can't stop thinking of Flor.
February 22, 2276. I believe it's possible to take the town, but I know the price is too high. Even if they take it, the Sand Wolves won't hold it. Thunder wants to kill all the settlers, women and children included. I have strictly forbade it. He doesn't understand the reaction this will bring. The town had an NCR flag flying over it.
We're going to attack the town in one week, so I've been relentlessly training everyone. Some will plant explosives, others will snipe the guards, a few will scale the walls early on and try to sabotage the front gate. Maybe we can pull it off.
February 23, 2276. We attack at dawn.
I'm watching Flor as I write this, sitting in my favorite cave above the campsite. It's been a nice, warm escape for us.
She's so beautiful that it pains me to think of her going on without me. But she'll have to. We talked about it, and she cried and held me when I told her I probably wouldn't come back. She asked me if she should stay or go. I told her it was her choice, but that she should marry again, and raise our child to be fair and strong, and not to raise their hand in violence. I made her promise me.
February 25, 2276. Final entry, most likely.
The attack failed, but it was so close. So close that I cry about it now. The scouts scaled the wall, knifed the sentries, but some drunk happened to see us, sounded the alarm. Can you imagine? Every other night we watched them, and it was the same routine, no surprises. He just happened to be there that one night, at that particular moment.
We rushed the square, managed to overwhelm the militia, but the miners and mercenaries emerged from the upper ridge armed and ready. It was a bloodbath. I took a slug to the stomach, and I'm fading now. The healing powder dulls the pain, but I can't help but think this is all my fault. I taught them to kill, made them hate. Maybe I'm no better than Caesar.
At least Flor still loves me. Unconditionally. That's a strong word. I can't write much more. Told her to leave. No future here.
ESP.TRADUIT:
2276年1月17日。
弗洛尔和一些家庭都很安全。除此之外，没有好消息。对沙狼来说，这是黑暗的一天。
今天早上，我和一些持不同政见的人(包括雷)，注意观察了来到我们的营地的新人。我们选择了一个遥远的、隐蔽的悬崖俯瞰这个地点。
一开始，我以为我的担心是徒劳的，因为整个代表团带着十个人回来了，显然没有受伤。所有的长者和高级部落成员都出现迎接他们，尽其所能地给客人提供食物、衣服和珠宝。这些人似乎很友好。
然而，在他们开始会面后不久，我在头顶上看到一个人问道:“这些人是你们的领导吗?”然后开始在沙子上做手势和画。有那么一会儿，我又回到了自己第一次遭遇的情景。几分钟后，这些人就确信他们已经和部落的长老们在一起了。然后他们就杀了他们。
根据他们使用武器的方式，很明显他们是雇佣兵。他们又快又有效率。首先，他们枪杀了六名长老，他们没有做出任何反应。接着，尖叫声和恐慌开始蔓延，真正的屠杀开始了。这些人在近距离用自动武器打光整个弹匣，不分青红皂白地向男人、女人和儿童开枪。我就好像被迫看着自己的家人在我面前被慢镜头屠杀。他们就像无助的、胆怯的动物，有的在祈祷和恳求，他们无法理解。而士兵们只是笑着继续射击。少数部落男子开始行动，其中一人甚至用矛打伤了一名雇佣兵。但这并不重要--他们被当场击毙。
雷也看着，开始抽泣。我抱着他，确保他保持沉默，但我也分担了他的悲伤和愤怒。当那些人最终离开时，我的感受就是--纯粹的愤怒。
现在我知道人类为什么讨厌了。
2276年1月18日。
我们昨天并没有全军覆没。许多人逃到了安全的地方，而我们一直在忙着收留遭受创伤的幸存者，把他们带到我们的新营地。这有太多的痛苦和不确定性。我们没有领导人。他们现在看着雷和我。我们必须战斗。
2276年1月21日。
我们已经埋葬了所有死者，现在我们要为清算做准备。他们中的大多数人杀过动物，所以教他们杀人并不难。打这里，切那里，砸这个，切那个。他们快速学会了。
现在只有雷和我了，我们是理事会。根据我的建议，我们决定以一种非常规的方式进行战斗。除了书本，我对战争知之甚少，但我们必须坚持自己的优势--熟悉地形、秘密行动、足智多谋和坚定信念。我记得战利品属于最忠诚的人。
我们必须弄到枪支。明天我将带领一支侦察队试图在峡谷入口附近设下埋伏。
弗洛尔现在经常哭，不是因为怀孕。我从没想过让她经历这种痛苦，这种担心。也许我应该带着她离开。
但现在太晚了。
2276年1月23日。
那次伏击取得了惊人的成功。令人惊讶的是，当我们接近目的地时，商队的守卫竟如此漫不经心。我们在黎明时分抓住了他们，沙狼表现得非常出色。我们无声无声息地向守卫们发射了一阵长矛，几乎当场打死了两人。旅行者们尖叫着，惊慌失措着，我们从遮蔽处跳出来，拿着棍棒、刀子和斧头向他们扑去。其中一个年轻的战士胸部中了一枪，但我们没有其他伤亡。
我们杀了所有移民，只留下了一个孩子。他将和我们一起成长。
2276年1月25日。
他们正以惊人的速度接受武器训练。我感谢格雷厄姆医生要求我上初级射击课，尽管当时我对此并不在意。
但有时我怀疑自己。今天我教女人和十几岁的男孩如何操作杀人机器以及杀人的最佳方法。
这就是爱德华·萨隆的感受吗?
2276年1月30日。
我们今天取得了胜利，感觉很好。
昨天，一名侦察兵在旧营地附近发现了一支雇佣兵巡逻队。他们装备精良，配有战斗装甲和榴弹发射器。但这并没有拯救他们。
我们晚上接近他们的营地，发现他们很聪明，派了两个哨兵。两个敏捷的战士一声不吭地干掉了那些笨手笨脚的混蛋。然后我们悄无声息地潜进去。不到一分钟就结束了，连枪都没开。他们尽了最大的努力，而我们却毫无损失地摧毁了他们。
也许我们能保住这个峡谷。
2276年2月15日。
在我们屠杀了那个雇佣兵巡逻队之后，峡谷沉寂了几个星期。巡逻队报告说有商队到镇上来了，除此之外就没什么了。显然他们在筑墙。我们一定给人留下了深刻的印象。
不幸的是，雷和我最近的意见有分歧。他主张对这个小镇进行全面进攻，认为我们的新火力会给我们带来优势。我拒绝，因为我们人数不多，没有装甲，也没有足够的训练来应付这样的血腥行动。伏击商队是一回事，在防守严密的位置协调进攻则完全是另一回事。我担心我们会被击溃，永远无法真正恢复。这个部落仍然处于脆弱的状态。
弗洛尔快到了。她继续为我担心，就像我为部落担心一样。自从营地遭到袭击以来，情况发生了很大的变化。勇敢和头皮现在是衡量男子气概的标准，单场战斗就能解决分歧。我们是紧密联系的，但是由于暴露在危险和战斗中而产生紧张。现在我们大多数人都是杀手。
2276年2月18日。
雷已经把我们的分歧提交给了总理事会，我们必须向整个部落陈述我们的观点。我担心他会激起他们的狂热，然后我们的命运就注定了。我要说的是我们需要耐心，等待时机，在他们最意想不到的时间和地点继续打击。这不是一条吸引人的路线，但却是可持续的。
2276年2月19日。
决定了--每个身体健全的战士都将参与对采矿城镇的攻击。
我被指派为一项可能不可能完成的任务起草一份计划。我很可能会让弗洛尔成为寡妇。
明天我将领导一个侦察任务来评估这个城镇的防御能力。我一直在想弗洛尔。
2276年2月22日。
我相信拿下这座城市是可能的，但我知道代价太高了。就算他们拿下了，沙狼也守不住。雷想杀死所有的定居者，包括妇女和儿童。我坚决反对。他不明白这会引起什么样的反应。这座城镇上空飘扬着NCR的旗帜。
我们要在一周内袭击这座城镇，所以我一直在训练大家。有些人会放置炸药，有些人会狙击警卫，还有一些人会在一开始就翻越墙壁，试图破坏前门。也许我们能成功。
2276年2月23日。
我们将在黎明时进攻。
我坐在营地上方我最喜欢的洞穴里，一边写这篇日记，一边看着弗洛尔。对我们来说，这是个温馨的逃离。
她太美了，一想到她独自生活我就很难过。但她必须这样做。我们讨论了这件事，当我告诉她我可能不会回来时，她哭着抱着我。她问我她是该走还是该留。我告诉她这是她的选择，但她应该再婚，把我们的孩子抚养得公平强壮，而不是用暴力。我让她务必答应我。
2276年2月25日。
很可能是最后一篇。
这次攻击失败了，但其实离成功很接近了，如此接近以至于我现在为之哭泣。
巡防队员爬上了墙，用刀砍倒了哨兵，但一些醉汉碰巧看到了我们，拉响了警报。你能想象吗?我们每隔一个晚上就看一次，节目都是一样的，没有惊喜。他只是碰巧在某个晚上，那个特定的时刻出现在那里。
我们冲进广场，制服了民兵，但矿工和雇佣兵从山脊上出来，全副武装，做好了准备。这是一场大屠杀。
我的胃中了一枪，我现在很虚弱。治疗粉可以减轻疼痛，但我忍不住觉得这都是我的错。我教他们杀人，让他们仇恨。也许我比凯撒好不了多少。
至少弗洛尔还爱我。无条件的。这个词太重了。我不能再写了。
叫她离开，这里没有未来。

ESP.ORIGINAL: Maria Lopez's diary
ESP.TRADUIT: 玛利亚·洛佩兹的日记

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Day 1: We're here! It's amazing to finally have a place of our own, without some landlord lording over us. There is room to move, air to breath, and a chance to make our living.
Folks at Silverwood warned us about the tribals, but they can't be any worse than the 80's. We all know how to handle a rifle, and we have a good view of the canyon. Tomorrow, we're going to build fences!
Day 2: Ground is tough here, and the digging was exhausting, but we got it done. I never want to touch a post hole digger again. Grandma looked after Juanito while we were outside. He makes her so happy, it's a such a delight to see her eyes light up when she's holding him.
Frank started to make a move on me tonight, but we were both too tired. Besides, one baby is enough for now. We have to buy livestock tomorrow.
Day 3: We went to meet with the herder outside Silverwood, and he sold us five head of Brahmin. I also made sure to buy some seed from the general store. That man Dobbs seems like a nice fellow. Some drunk named Charlie almost vomited on my dress. I wish they'd run off that sort of riff-raff. I'm so glad we aren't crammed in that cesspool.
Day 4: This morning was frightening. We heard a sound at dawn, and Frank went for his rifle, I grabbed the baby. All he found was a single tomahawk that had been lodged into the door. It was so primitive, yet deadly. I imagine these tribals are angry about our presence. Can't they understand we just want to live in peace?
Frank went to talk with the sheriff while I planted some crops. Sheriff told him that there aren't enough militia to spare, and that we'll just have to "remain vigilant". What a pendejo!
Day 5: The Brahmin are all dead. They killed them in the night, with nary a noise, just cut their throats, even the calves. The land office told us this was safe, a way to avoid the crime and cost of the city. If I'd have known what kind of people these tribals were, I don't know if I'd have made the same decision.
Frank and I are armed at all times. I'm scared.
Day 6: Frank killed one of them last night.
He couldn't sleep, so he just sat in a chair, watching the door, clutching his rifle. I drifted off around midnight, but the gunfire woke me up a few hours later. It was a young man - a boy, really, armed with a club and some spears. Frank said he wasn't alone, that they'd tried to enter through the front door. Thank God Frank was waiting for them. We're going to leave this place once Frank gets a job in town, probably at the mine.
Day 7: While Frank was at town, I saw the tribals kill a hunter from town. I was tending the garden when I heard the gunfire and screams down in the valley. The three tribals had been waiting on the hunter. He caught a spear in his leg and went down.
He managed to fell one of the savages, but the other two were on him in an instant. They did things to him, things I can't describe. I keep remembering it, hearing the hunter's awful, ungodly screams, like an animal being butchered. The tribals laughed.
Day 8: Frank said the mine won't hire him. We will have to stay here, or move into town and live in the streets. We're going to pray tonight, ask God to watch over us, and then make a decision. I have lived on the streets before, and I'd almost rather die than experience it again. This farm is our future, and we have to be strong, if only for Juanito's sake.
We will stay here. We will hope. We will pray.
ESP.TRADUIT:
第一天:
我们来到了这里!我们终于有了自己的房子，再也没有什么房东会对我们颐指气使。真是太棒了，有活动的空间，有呼吸的空气，有生存的机会。
银木镇的人警告过我们要提防部落民，但他们不会比80年代帮更糟。我们都知道如何使用步枪，我们也能很好地欣赏峡谷。明天，我们要建篱笆!
第二天:
这里的土地很艰苦，挖掘工作也很辛苦，但我们完成了。我再也不想碰挖坑机了。我们在外面的时候，奶奶照看着华尼托。他让她很开心，当她抱着他的时候，我看到她的眼中充满喜悦。
弗兰克今晚开始对我动手动脚，但我们都太累了。再说，现在一个孩子就够了。我们明天得去买牲畜。
第三天:
我们去银木镇城外见了一个牧人，他卖给我们五个婆罗门首领。我还从杂货店买了一些种子。多布斯看起来是个好人。有个叫查理的醉汉差点吐在我裙子上。我真希望他们能和那种乌合之众断绝来往。真高兴我们没被塞进那个污水坑里。
第四天:
今天早上很可怕。我们在黎明听到一个声音，弗兰克去拿他的步枪，我抱住了婴儿。他只找到一把嵌在门上的战斧。它是如此原始，却又致命。我想这些部落对我们的存在很生气。难道他们不明白我们只想过和平的生活吗?
我在种庄稼的时候，弗兰克去和治安官谈了。治安官告诉他现在没有足够的民兵，我们只能“保持警惕”。傻逼!
第五天:
婆罗门都死了。他们在夜里杀了他们，没有一点声音，只是割了他们的喉咙，甚至包括小牛。土地办公室告诉我们这里很安全，可以远离犯罪和城市生活的成本。如果我知道这些部落是什么样的人，我不知道我是否会做出同样的决定。
弗兰克和我随时都带着武器。我很害怕。
第六天:
弗兰克昨晚杀了一个人。
他睡不着，就坐在椅子上，手握步枪，望着门口。我在午夜时分迷迷糊糊地睡着了，但几小时后枪声把我吵醒了。那是一个年轻人--一个男孩，真的，带着一根棍棒和一些矛。弗兰克说他不是一个人，他们试图从前门进去。感谢上帝，弗兰克在等着他们。等弗兰克在镇上找到工作，可能在矿场，我们就离开这里。
第七天:
当弗兰克在镇上的时候，我看到部落民杀死了一个镇上的猎人。我正在照料花园，突然听到山谷里传来枪声和尖叫声。三个部落民一直在等着猎人。他的腿中了一根矛，倒了下去。
他设法击倒了其中一个野人，但另外两个立刻扑了上去。他们对他做了我无法形容的事。我一直记着，听到猎人可怕的，邪恶的尖叫，就像动物被宰杀一样。他的族人都笑了。
第八天:
弗兰克说矿场不会雇他。我们将不得不留在这里，或者搬到城里住在街上。我们今晚要祈祷，祈求上帝保佑我们，然后做出决定。我以前在街上生活过，我宁愿死也不愿再经历一次。这个农场是我们的未来，我们必须坚强，哪怕只是为了华尼托。
我们要留在这里。我们会充满希望。我们会祈祷。

ESP.ORIGINAL: Last night here
ESP.TRADUIT: 最后一晚

ESP.ORIGINAL:
It's the last night in the cabin, and I just felt like writing for some reason. Maybe it's the thought of Sandra. I can see her green eyes, haunting me as we lie together, still young and bold, alive. Our cabin wasn't too different from this one.
Was this all just a lie to make me feel alive again? Has it changed anything?
It's quiet up here, except for Tucker's snoring. The lights from Vegas peek through the cracks in the south wall. Some of the boys are bothered by the sound of coyotes, but they put me at ease. They're natural things, doing what they're supposed to. Maybe it's just my nature to do what I've been doing. I feel it's going to end soon.
What would Sandra say if she saw what I'd become? I can't think about it now.
We meet Hendershot tomorrow. Gonna need firepower for the next job.
ESP.TRADUIT:
这是我在小木屋的最后一晚了，不知为什么，我很想写点东西。也许是因为想到桑德拉。当我们躺在一起时，我能看到她那双绿色的眼睛萦绕在我的心头，她依然年轻，勇敢，充满活力。我们的小屋和这个没什么不同。
这一切只是为了让我重获新生的谎言吗?有什么变化吗?
这里很安静，除了塔克的鼾声。维加斯的灯光从南墙的缝隙中透出。有些男孩被郊狼的声音困扰着，但他们让我放松了。它们很自然，在做它们该做的事。也许做我一直在做的事正是我的天性。我觉得很快就要结束了。
如果桑德拉看到我变成这样，她会怎么说?我现在不能想它。
我们明天见亨德肖特。下一个任务需要火力。

ESP.ORIGINAL: To Do
ESP.TRADUIT: 要做的

ESP.ORIGINAL:
To Do: - Re-fit focus optics for laser rifle - Check coolant levels in reactor - Leave radroaches for ferals - Repair camera in front office - Check west corridor for signs of the "Diggers" - Buy nuka cola!
Fucking Glanton and his boys cleaned out my stock of soda, taking my hospitality for granted. At least he pays up front and on time. I'm guessing that Finley and the Khans won't be such gracious hosts.
ESP.TRADUIT:
要做的:
-重新安装激光步枪的聚焦光学元件
-检查反应堆冷却剂水平
-远离辐射蟑螂和野性尸鬼
-维修前厅的摄像头
-检查西面走廊是否有“挖掘者”的痕迹
-买核子可乐！
该死的格兰顿和他的手下把我库存的苏打水都喝光了，不把我的热情好客当回事。至少他按时付了定金。我猜芬利和大汗帮不会是这么客气的主人。

ESP.ORIGINAL: Face Me
ESP.TRADUIT: 面对我

ESP.ORIGINAL:
To the leaders of Silverwood:
You have exhibited bravery in the spirited defense of your village, but it will only delay the inevitable.
Out of respect for your fortitude, I extend to you an offer - send two champions to face me in single combat, and I will postpone the next attack. Should they defeat me, my forces will return to Arizona. If they fall, I will award your populace with slavery in lieu of crucifixion.
If you ignore this gesture, I will crucify the men and force them to watch as I roast the women and children. Do not doubt my resolve, profligates.
The choice is yours.
ESP.TRADUIT:
致银木森林的领袖们:
你在英勇保卫村庄的过程中表现得很勇敢，但这只会拖延不可避免的事情。
出于对你坚忍不拔的尊重，我向你提出一个建议--派两名勇士来与我单打独斗，我将推迟下一次进攻。如果他们打败我，我的军队就会回到亚利桑那。如果他们倒下了，我将用奴役来奖励你的人民，而不是钉死在十字架上。
如果你无视我的表示，我就把男人钉死在十字架上强迫他们看着我烤女人和孩子。不要怀疑我的决心，浪荡子。
选择权在你。

ESP.ORIGINAL: Be Warned
ESP.TRADUIT: 该小心了

ESP.ORIGINAL:
To the vermin who call themselves Powder Gangers:
You will no longer harm or harass the citizens of Primm. Disregard this warning, and not even God himself will save you from my blade.
Look at your comrades, smell their fetid remains, gasp at their maggot-infested cadavers. That is what awaits the villains who doubt my resolve.
- Glanton
ESP.TRADUIT:
对那些自称炸药帮派的害虫:
你不能再伤害或骚扰普瑞姆的居民了。如果无视这个警告，就算是上帝也不会把你们从我的刀下救出来。
看看你的同志们，闻一闻他们恶臭的尸体，倒吸一口凉气。这就是那些怀疑我决心的恶棍们等到的。
- 格兰顿

ESP.ORIGINAL: Jackpot!
ESP.TRADUIT: 中头奖了！

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Billy,
Sheriff told me a group of prospectors are setting out for that cave on the other side of the canyon. Ain't seen too many Sand Wolves around, so it should be safe. Word is that that there's a silver vein inside, just waiting to be claimed. All we have to do is blast our way inside. Have your pickaxe and dynamite ready - we're leaving at midnight!
- Jake
ESP.TRADUIT:
比利,
治安官告诉我一群勘探者正前往峡谷另一边的那个洞穴。附近没见过太多沙狼，所以应该很安全。据说里面有条银脉，等着被人认领。我们要做的就是炸出一条路进去。准备好你的鹤嘴锄和炸药，我们午夜出发！
- 杰克
